oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sharps carbine bullet
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A bullet from a Sharps carbine dug at Pine Bluff near Lawrenceburg, Tennessee. The Sharp's was among the most commonly used breechloading carbines in the Civil War. The Federal Army armed many of its cavalry regiments with the Sharps. Nathan Bedford Forrest's Escort Company also used the Sharps carbine.
